Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BVP (Derived from pEM-2 and MP-VT1 and MP-B)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.27591703] Gram-positive bacteria :Staphylococcus aureus isolates(MIC=24.0 ± 13.9 mg/L, MBC=37.3 ± 24.4 mg/L), Enterococcus faecalis isolates(MIC=12.0 ± 6.9 mg/L, MBC=18.7 ± 12.2 mg/L);Gram-negative bacteria :Pseudomonas aeruginosa isolates(MIC=16.0 ± 13.9 mg/L, MBC=18.7 ± 12.2 mg/L), Acinetobacter baumannii isolates(MIC=8.0 ± 0.0 mg/L, MBC=10.7 ± 4.6 mg/L)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.27591703] 0% hemolysis at 64 μg/ml against human red blood cells; 0% hemolysis at 16 μg/ml , 2.5% hemolysis at 32 μg/ml , 10% hemolysis at 64 μg/ml against sheep red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.27591703] The cell viability of HEK293 cells induced by PV is 98.9%, 95.4%, 89.7%, 83.4%, 83.1%, 73.7% and 71.5% at peptide concentrations of 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64 μg/mL within 24h.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria

Literature.Title: Design and characterization of short hybrid antimicrobial peptides from pEM-2, mastoparan-VT1, and mastoparan-B.
Literature.Reference: Chem Biol Drug Des. 2017 Mar;89(3)327-338. doi 10.1111/cbdd.12864.
Literature.Author: Memariani H, Shahbazzadeh D, Ranjbar R, Behdani M, Memariani M, Pooshang Bagheri K

Literature.Title: Rational Evolution of Antimicrobial Peptides Containing Unnatural Amino Acids to Combat Burn Wound Infections
Literature.Author: Xiong M, Chen M, Zhang J
